Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format

Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format Class Reference

Detailed Description

Class representing wrapper for AS_Format.

  • typedef System::UInt32 State
    Volume state returned from get_State.

Member Function Documentation

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::Open ( InfoCallback^   cb,
System::IntPtr  userData 
) [new]

DESCRIPTION: Open a format creating a data structure in RAM that is ready to receive file structure information from the media in the specified device.

A callback will report on the progress of the operation is specified with callback. The parameter userdata allows the host application to specify a pointer to a memory location that will be passed back whenever the callback is called.

Parameters:
[in] cb - progress callback function
[in] userData - progress callback userdata
NOTE:
You can retrieve Volume.FormatType to get current volume FS detected after this function is called.

Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the flags are not defined.

StorageError.DeviceNotReady - if there is no media recognized in device

Reimplemented from Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume.

Volume::FormatType  formatType,
System::String^   volumeName,
Volume::AccessFlag  accessFlag,

System::IntPtr  userData

SInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::Close (  )  [new]

Close this format and free the format object - all changes lost if not committed with Volume.Flush first.

Returns:
StorageError.None - ok

StorageError.InvalidParameter - if the volume is not open

Reimplemented from Sonic::ManagedStorage::Volume.

Property Documentation

System:: UInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::LayerBlocks [get]

blocks in a layer (for multi-layer only after _Prepare()) propertyIndex = layer number

LogicalLayerBreak^ Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::LayerBreak [get, set]

into a file where the LB should be

LogicalLayerBreak struct, specifies the byte offset

System:: UInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::DDP_TrackPath [get, set]

0 = Opposite Track Path DVD-ROM Being requested 1 = Parallel Track Path DVD-ROM being requested

System:: UInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::DDP_StorageMode [get, set]

0 = User data only, 2048 bytes 1 = Complete 2054 bytes 6 = (currently not supported) Incomplete 2064 bytes 7 = (currently not supported) Complete 2064 bytes

String^ Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::DDP_InputImage [set]

This is optional and is only to be used when an image already exists, that the client wants to create a DDP (or CMF) set from. (image assumed to be only user data 2048 bytes per sector)

System:: UInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::DDP2_SscrStatus [get, set]

0 = The data for the disc contains no security scrambling. The final disc will not be scrambled for security. 1 = The data for the disc contains no security scrambling. The final disc will be scrambled for security. 2 = (currently not supported) The data for the disc contains security scrambling. The final disc will be scrambled for security. 3 = The data for the disc contains no security scrambling. The security scrambling keys are read from a floppy disk. Format the floppy according to CSS Site Guide Book. The final disc will be scrambled for security.

System:: UInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::DDP3_MediaType [get, set]

0 = HD DVD-ROM (default) 1 = HD DVD-ROM Twin Format - indicates that layer 0 will contain a Standard Density DVD image and current DDP set is single layer that will go on layer 1 of destination disc 2 = 3X-SPEED DVD-ROM

System:: UInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::BDCMF_BD_Type [set]

0 = BD (default) 1 = BD9 (BD content on DVD-ROM)

System:: UInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::BDCMF_HybridType [set]

0 = no hybrid (default) 1 = BD with CD hybrid 2 = BD with DVD hybrid

System:: UInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::BDCMF_RegionControl [set]

0 = Allowed (default) 1 = Limited 2 = Prohibited PropertyIndex parameter indicates which Region 0 = Region A (default) 1 = Region B 2 = Region C These regions must all be set or none. By setting one of them (i.e., A), the others (i.e., B and C) will all be all be set to the default (Allowed) until set explicitly.

System:: UInt32 Sonic::ManagedStorage::Format::BDCMF_Category [set]

UInt32 indicates category type: 0 = BD-ROM Movie Media (default) 1 = BD-ROM Non-Commercial Audiovisual Media 2 = BD-ROM Data Media
